# Debug Trace Profile Docs

- [Debugging, tracing, and profiling](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/framework/debug-trace-profile/index.md): Read about debugging, tracing, and profiling in .NET. See articles covering just-in-time (JIT) debugging, tracing and instrumenting applications, and more.
- [Enabling JIT-Attach Debugging](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/framework/debug-trace-profile/enabling-jit-attach-debugging.md): Enable just-in time (JIT) attach debugging to attach a debugger to a process when you encounter errors. It can be triggered by certain methods or functions.
- [Making an Image Easier to Debug](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/framework/debug-trace-profile/making-an-image-easier-to-debug.md): Learn how to configure an executable image for easier debugging using IDE switches and command-line options.
- [Enhancing Debugging with the Debugger Display Attributes](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/framework/debug-trace-profile/enhancing-debugging-with-the-debugger-display-attributes.md): Get started with debugger display attributes in .NET, which allow the type developer to also specify what the type will look like when it's shown in a debugger.
- [Runtime Profiling](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/framework/debug-trace-profile/runtime-profiling.md): Explore runtime profiling in .NET, which is a method of gathering performance data in any development or deployment scenario.
- [Performance Counters](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/framework/debug-trace-profile/performance-counters.md): Read about performance counters in .NET. There are performance counters for exceptions, interop, JIT compilers, loading, memory, networking, security, and more.
- [Performance Counters and In-Process Side-By-Side Applications](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/framework/debug-trace-profile/performance-counters-and-in-process-side-by-side-applications.md): Review performance counters and in-process side-by-side applications in .NET. Use Perfmon.exe to differentiate the performance counters on a per-runtime basis.

## Diagnosing Errors with Managed Debugging Assistants

- [Diagnosing Errors with Managed Debugging Assistants](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/framework/debug-trace-profile/diagnosing-errors-with-managed-debugging-assistants.md): Diagnose errors in .NET with managed debugging assistants. MDAs are debugging aids working with the CLR to provide runtime state information.
- [asynchronousThreadAbort](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/framework/debug-trace-profile/asynchronousthreadabort-mda.md): Review how the asynchronousThreadAbort managed debugging assistant (MDA) is activated when a thread tries to put an asynchronous abort into another thread.
- [bindingFailure](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/framework/debug-trace-profile/bindingfailure-mda.md): Read about the bindingFailure managed debugging assistant (MDA), which is activated when an assembly fails to load in .NET.
- [callbackOnCollectedDelegate](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/framework/debug-trace-profile/callbackoncollecteddelegate-mda.md): Review the callbackOnCollectedDelegate managed debugging assistant (MDA) in .NET, which is invoked if a callback occurs after the delegate is garbage collected.
- [contextSwitchDeadlock](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/framework/debug-trace-profile/contextswitchdeadlock-mda.md): Read about the contextSwitchDeadlock managed debugging assistant (MDA) in .NET, which is activated when a deadlock is detected during a COM context transition.
- [dangerousThreadingAPI](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/framework/debug-trace-profile/dangerousthreadingapi-mda.md): Review the dangerousThreadingAPI managed debugging assistant (MDA), which is activated when Thread.Suspend is called on a thread other than the current thread.
- [dateTimeInvalidLocalFormat](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/framework/debug-trace-profile/datetimeinvalidlocalformat-mda.md): Review the dateTimeInvalidLocalFormat managed debugging assistant (MDA), which is activated when a UTC-stored DateTime value gets a local-only DateTime format.
- [dirtyCastAndCallOnInterface](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/framework/debug-trace-profile/dirtycastandcalloninterface-mda.md): Review the dirtyCastAndCallOnInterface managed debugging assistant, which is invoked when early-bound vtable calls are done on late-bound only class interfaces.
- [disconnectedContext](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/framework/debug-trace-profile/disconnectedcontext-mda.md): Review the disconnectedContext managed debugging assistant in .NET, which is invoked when the CLR tries to transition into a disconnected apartment or context.
- [dllMainReturnsFalse](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/framework/debug-trace-profile/dllmainreturnsfalse-mda.md): Read about the dllMainReturnsFalse managed debugging assistant in .NET. This MDA is activated if DLL initialization failed.
- [exceptionSwallowedOnCallFromCom](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/framework/debug-trace-profile/exceptionswallowedoncallfromcom-mda.md): Review the exceptionSwallowedOnCallFromCOM managed debugging assistant in .NET. This MDA occurs if an exception was thrown but there's no good way to report it.
- [failedQI](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/framework/debug-trace-profile/failedqi-mda.md): Review the failedQI managed debugging assistant (MDA) in .NET, which may be activated when a cast on or a COM call from a runtime callable wrapper (RCW) fails.
- [fatalExecutionEngineError](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/framework/debug-trace-profile/fatalexecutionengineerror-mda.md): Review the fatalExecutionEngineError managed debugging assistant (MDA) in .NET, which may activate because of an unexpected process termination.
- [gcManagedToUnmanaged](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/framework/debug-trace-profile/gcmanagedtounmanaged-mda.md): Review the gcManagedToUnmanaged managed debugging assistant. This MDA may activate because of premature garbage collection during transition to unmanaged code.
- [gcUnmanagedToManaged](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/framework/debug-trace-profile/gcunmanagedtomanaged-mda.md): Review the gcManagedToUnmanaged managed debugging assistant in .NET. This MDA may activate because of garbage heap corruption during transition to managed code.
- [illegalPrepareConstrainedRegion](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/framework/debug-trace-profile/illegalprepareconstrainedregion-mda.md): Review the illegalPrepareConstrainedRegion managed debugging assistant, which is invoked if a PrepareConstrainedRegions call isn't followed by a try statement.
- [invalidApartmentStateChange](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/framework/debug-trace-profile/invalidapartmentstatechange-mda.md): Learn about the invalidApartmentStateChange managed debugging assistant (MDA) in .NET, which is activated if there are problems with the COM apartment state.
- [invalidCERCall](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/framework/debug-trace-profile/invalidcercall-mda.md): Review the invalidCERCall managed debugging assistant (MDA), which is activated if there's an invalid call within the constrained execution region (CER) graph.
- [invalidFunctionPointerInDelegate](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/framework/debug-trace-profile/invalidfunctionpointerindelegate-mda.md): Review the invalidFunctionPointerInDelegate managed debugging assistant (MDA), which is invoked if an invalid function pointer is passed in to make a delegate.
- [invalidGCHandleCookie](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/framework/debug-trace-profile/invalidgchandlecookie-mda.md): Review the invalidGCHandleCookie managed debugging assistant (MDA), which is activated when a conversion from an invalid IntPtr cookie to a GCHandle is tried.
- [invalidIUnknown](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/framework/debug-trace-profile/invalidiunknown-mda.md): Review the invalidIUnknown managed debugging assistant (MDA), which is activated when an invalid IUnknown pointer is passed to managed code from native code.
- [invalidMemberDeclaration](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/framework/debug-trace-profile/invalidmemberdeclaration-mda.md): Review the invalidMemberDeclaration managed debugging assistant, which is invoked if a failure HRESULT is returned to COM without calling the managed method.
- [invalidOverlappedToPinvoke](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/framework/debug-trace-profile/invalidoverlappedtopinvoke-mda.md): Review the invalidOverlappedToPinvoke managed debugging assistant (MDA) in .NET, which may be activated during a crash or an unexplainable heap corruption.
- [invalidVariant](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/framework/debug-trace-profile/invalidvariant-mda.md): Review the invalidVariant managed debugging assistant, which is invoked if an invalid VARIANT is encountered in a call from native/unmanaged to managed code.
- [jitCompilationStart](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/framework/debug-trace-profile/jitcompilationstart-mda.md): The jitCompilationStart managed debugging assistant (MDA) reports when the just-in-time (JIT) compiler begins compiling a .NET function.
- [loaderLock](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/framework/debug-trace-profile/loaderlock-mda.md): Review the loaderLock managed debugging assistant (MDA) in .NET, which detects attempts to run managed code on a thread holding the Windows OS loader lock.
- [loadFromContext](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/framework/debug-trace-profile/loadfromcontext-mda.md): Understand the loadFromContext managed debugging assistant (MDA) in .NET, which is activated if an assembly is loaded into the LoadFrom context.
- [marshalCleanupError](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/framework/debug-trace-profile/marshalcleanuperror-mda.md): Review the marshalCleanupError managed debugging assistant (MDA), which is invoked because an unexpected error occurred while cleaning up temporary structures.
- [marshaling](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/framework/debug-trace-profile/marshaling-mda.md): Review the marshaling managed debugging assistant (MDA), which is invoked if the CLR sets up marshalling information for a method parameter or a structure field.
- [memberInfoCacheCreation](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/framework/debug-trace-profile/memberinfocachecreation-mda.md): Understand the memberInfoCacheCreation managed debugging assistant (MDA) in .NET, which is activated when a MemberInfo cache is created.
- [moduloObjectHashcode](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/framework/debug-trace-profile/moduloobjecthashcode-mda.md): Review the moduloObjectHashcode managed debugging assistant (MDA), which changes the Object class to get a remainder value on a GetHashCode method result.
- [nonComVisibleBaseClass](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/framework/debug-trace-profile/noncomvisiblebaseclass-mda.md): See the nonComVisibleBaseClass managed debugging assistant (MDA), which is invoked on QueryInterface calls from native code failing with COR_E_INVALIDOPERATION.
- [notMarshalable](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/framework/debug-trace-profile/notmarshalable-mda.md): Review the notMarshalable managed debugging assistant, which may activate if calls aren't serviced or occur in the wrong context for COM interface pointers.
- [openGenericCERCall](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/framework/debug-trace-profile/opengenericcercall-mda.md): See the openGenericCERCall managed debugging assistant, which may activate if CER code doesn't run when a thread aborts or when an application domain unloads.
- [overlappedFreeError](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/framework/debug-trace-profile/overlappedfreeerror-mda.md): Review the overlappedFreeError managed debugging assistant (MDA) in .NET, which may activate on access violations or corruption of the garbage-collected heap.
- [pInvokeLog](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/framework/debug-trace-profile/pinvokelog-mda.md): Understand the pInvokeLog managed debugging assistant (MDA), which is activated for each unique platform invoke signature used during execution in .NET.
- [pInvokeStackImbalance](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/framework/debug-trace-profile/pinvokestackimbalance-mda.md): Review the PInvokeStackImbalance MDA, which may be activated during an access violation or memory corruption when making or following a platform invoke call.
